        Returns a subset of users from a given set of users that match a given criteria eligible for assignment.
        Parameters:
        attributeBasedAssignmentCriteria - Criteria for determining candidate users
        group - Group that the users are associated with
        includeSubGroups - whether to include child groups of the given group
        Returns:
        a subset of users that match given criteria

      • assignUnassignedViews

        public static void assignUnassignedViews(Location webLocation,
                                         ActivityUnassignedView[] activityViews)
        Brings up the assignment popup for the assignables specified by an array of ActivityUnassignedView entities. Each view entity corresponds with an assignment review activity, and each assignment review activity corresponds to an assignable - an assignment review activity represents the responsibility for assigning some other object. So, for example, one assignment review activity might correspond to a claim, another might correspond to an exposure, another to a matter and so on.

        This method finds all the assignables corresponding to the given assignment review activities (the activities are specified via view entities, but the view entities can be used to get the actual activities). If the assignables are all of the same type then the appropriate assignment popup is displayed. So if all the assignment review activities correspond to claims then it will bring up the assign claim popup.

        If the assignables are of mixed types (for example if one assignment review activity corresponds to a claim but another corresponds to an exposure) then a UserDisplayableException is thrown to explain the problem to the user.

        Parameters:
        webLocation - the current PCF location.
        activityViews - an array of activity view entities, each corresponding to an assignment review activity which further corresponds to another assignable.
        Throws:
        com.guidewire.pl.web.controller.UserDisplayableException - if the assignment review activities correspond to more than one type of object.
